content:
You have removed hotmail account from Thunderbird. So I'm presuming you do not have that account in Thunderbird at this moment. Please check all the following is also removed.

Check outgoing server for hotmail account is removed

  • Account Settings > Outgoing Server (SMTP)
  • REmove the hotmail/smtp.office365.com smtp from the list.

Check cookies are enabled

  • Menu > Settings > Privacy & Security

Under 'WEb Content' section

  • Select checkbox: 'Accept cookies from sites'
  • Accept third party cookies: 'Always'
  • Keep until: 'they expire'

Check passwords are removed: Whilst in 'Privacy & Security section...

  • Scroll to Passwords section
  • click on 'Saved Passwords'
  • Click on 'Show Passwords'
  • Locate any line which mentions the hotmail account and clickon 'Remove', so no passwods are stored for the account.
  • click on 'Close'

Check javascript is enabled:

  • Menu > Settings > General
  • Scroll to bottom
  • click on 'Config Editor'
  • In top search type: java
  • look for : javascript.enabled
  • If it = True - all is ok
  • If it = False, then use right toggle icon to set as True.

Exit Thunderbird

Check - if using a VPN - switch it off Check - if you have any program using the localhost eg: Apache - switch it off - note you can switch it back on after setting up hotmail.

Start Thunderbird.

Menu > New > Existing mail account

  • Enter name
  • Enter email address
  • Select to remember password
  • click on 'Configure Manually'

Incoming:

  • Select protocol 'IMAP'
  • Incoming Server : outlook.office365.com
  • Port: 993
  • Connection Security: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication Method: OAuth2
  • User name: full email address

SMTP outgoing server

  • server name : smtp.office365.com
  • Port: 587
  • Connection Security: STARTTLS
  • Authentication Method: OAuth2
  • User name: full email address

Click on 'Done'

You should get a pop up from MS Office asking for email address and password (same password you use to access webmail account) this is to confirm you really are you and to allow Thunderbird access to server.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
re :the View menu item is gone

What version of Thunderbird are you using ?

In the 102 series: 'View' is on the 'Menu Bar' eg: File, Edit, View, Go etc If 'Menu Bar' is missing - press 'Alt' key to get a temporary toolbar then use 'View' > 'Layout' > 'Menu Bar' to set as permanent.

'View' is also on the 'Menu icon' (3 horizontal lines) which is on the 'Mail toolbar' on the right side.

There is no such thing as a 'preview' of anything other than a preview of what you want to print, so you check what it looks like prior to actual printing.

Therefore, I'm assuming you are talking about the 'Message Pane' which by default is located below the 'Thread Pane'; sometimes called the 'Message List'.

'View' > 'Layout' > 'Message Pane' It can also be toggled on/off by using the shortcut key 'F8'.

If Thunderbird forgot your settings which are stored in the session files, then check to see if you have a program which is cleaning up temp files. Advise you do not allow any Anti-Virus or other Clean up types of program eg: CCleaner, WiseCleaner etc access to scanning your profile name folder - it should be set up as exempt from scanning or removal of any temp files.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Thunderbird'ün sol tarafındaki bölmeden hesap adınıza sağ tıklayıp Abone ol'u seçin. Açılan pencerede Tazele'ye tıklayın.

Kayıp dizinleri burada görüyorsanız işaretleyerek yeniden abone olabilirsiniz.

IMAP kullanırken dizinleriniz Thunderbird'de değil de e-posta sunucunuzda tutulur. Büyük ihtimalle e-posta sağlayıcınızın size verdiği bir webmail arayüzü vardır. Mevcut dizinleri oradan da kontrol edebilir ve yönetebilirsiniz.

content: Change the smtp authentication method to OAuth2, remove the entry for outlook smtp in Saved Passwords in Settings, then restart TB, send a test message, and enter the account password in the OAuth window. You might not even be prompted for credentials if you already have OAuth2 for the incoming server. Tested and working here in 102/W10.
